utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah! Yeah! OK! Sure! Look! Can we...can we talk about what happened here last night?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sure! Just give me a second to get all huffy and weird like you! Do you believe that who ever did something over here last night did what they did or didn't do ...I mean come on!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: OK you...you really don't know what I am talking about?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: OK! Last night after the party I saw Rachel kissing that jerk from her office out on your balcony.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Our balcony? Seriously? That's so funny because I told Monica we should put lights on our balcony. And she said "No, no. It's too cold, nobody will go out there." And I said "Maybe if we put some light out there they will"

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Right that's why I came over to talk about. Hum...I saw Rachel kissing some guy on your balcony, even though there were NO LIGHTS !

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So are you gonna...talk to her?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why...Why should I? I mean if she wants to move on, that's fine!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You know when "That's fine" sounds true when someone yells it and spits!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No I'm serious. I mean she wants to date people? Fine! I don't care but...at least she could have told me. You know I...I've been putting my life on hold and just concentrating on Emma but if she wants to go out there kissing guys she barely knows, then so will I ! Very funny! Ross is gay! Ah! Ah!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No no no. Good. So you're moving on? Do you have any idea where you're moving?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't know. I mean I have plenty of opportunity. Just just now there were some women at the coffee house smiled at me. And then the other day on the subway a woman "accidentally" sat on my hand.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Dude, don't rub my face in your crazy single life!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, and how about this? There is an anthropologist at school who totally came on to me during the inter-departmental Potluck dinner.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why did I get married?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! Let me ask you guys something. I have a new headshot taken tomorrow right and the photographer said she thinks I should have my eyebrows waxed. Is that weird for a guy?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well it depends.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: On how far along he's in the sex change process!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No I totally disagree. No I think it's fine for a guy to do something like that. Such you an actor. Not that you need to, your eyebrows are...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ok! Stop it you guys! Stop staring! You're freaking me out!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Your knuckles are kinda hairy too...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh man! I have to get those done too?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! Talking about high maintenance

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey hey! You dye your hair!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I'm a woman!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Arghhh! Double standards!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh before I forget, are you coming to Mike's piano bar tonight?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Only if I don't have to get up and sing.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But everybody sings. It's so much fun! Last time this adorable old man got out there, forgot all of the words, flipped out and everyone booed him off the stage. So funny.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It's just, I'm not good at singing.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! What's the matter? Are you scared? You're afraid I'm a better singer? You're afraid I'm gonna beat you at singing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No no, it's not working on me. Wow! I must be growing up!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: OK fine! Please come and support Mike. You don't have to sing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So I don't have to sing and I can just sit there and pass judgments on others?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: While drinking...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm there!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi guys! Listen I really need your help. I think I did something really stupid.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well yes Rachel but you got something so beautiful out there

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No not that. I kissed Gavin last night.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my god.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You kissed him?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. It was after the party, we were on the balcony and...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait wait wait. I was at home the whole time. How did I missed that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It was the end of the party, you were probably ironing wrapping paper.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh yeah...So how did you end up kissing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You know we were all alone and he was being really nice to me and, oh and he gave me this scarf...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I thought you hated him?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You know honey, there is a thin line between love and hate, and it turns out that line...is a scarf!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So are you thinking of starting up something with this guy?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don't know. It's so complicated. I work with this guy, you know, I have the baby, and I have Ross, and I just...I don't know what to do and I have to be at the office and see Gavin in ten minutes.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sounds like you need to think about what you want, talk to Gavin, and you definitely should talk to Ross

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Or...I could call in sick and not deal with it at all...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! Five-month maternity leave, you're back for four days, kiss a co-worker, call in sick, they are lucky to have you!

utterance.speaker: Salon girl
utterance.content: Hi

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey. I'm here for my eyebrow appointment.

utterance.speaker: Salon girl
utterance.content: Name?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Chandler Bing.

utterance.speaker: Salon girl
utterance.content: Ok. Very good. Have a seat right over here Mr. Bing and Sonia will be right with you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: OK Thanks. . I touched the stuff

utterance.speaker: Sonia
utterance.content: I'll take care of it

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks. Do you get a lot of guys in here?

utterance.speaker: Sonia
utterance.content: Oh absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh good...

utterance.speaker: Sonia
utterance.content: Are you looking to meet somebody?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right let's just do this.

utterance.speaker: Sonia
utterance.content: We'll get to the wax in a minute. First I want to tweeze some of the strays, ok? This may sting just a little bit...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Please I have an extremely high threshold...Holly Mother Of God! My face! My face! I'm all right! I'm all right! Just a little bit of shock that's all but I'll be fine you can go again. I'm OK Dammit! Woman! How Hoooow!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey it's the most eligible man in NY. How's the moving on going?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Not well. I went on the subway again and someone did sit on my hand but that person was neither female nor wearing pants.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well maybe you're going about this the wrong way. You know I mean think about it. Single white male, divorced three times, two illegitimate children. The personal ad writes itself....

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That's funny...Do you think you'll ever work again?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What are doing? You know I can only dish it out!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I can't believe Rachel just moved on and didn't say anything to me

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Maybe she didn't move on, you know...maybe that kiss was just an impulsive one-time birthday thing

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No no, about a month ago she gave her number to some guy in a bar.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Did she go out with him?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No. When he called, I...I threw the message away.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah! The high road...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know what? Enough! Enough talking! I have to get moving! Hey check out those two blondes over there! Hey come with me!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are you trying to get everybody divorced?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You don't have to do anything. It will just be easier if it is the two of us, like college, remember? You...you break the ice with some kind of jokes so that they know you're the funny one and I swoop in with some interesting conversation, so they'll see that I'm the brilliant, brooding, sexy one...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I thought I had to make the jokes!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Don't you have to be at work?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh come on! Hello! Hi! My name is Chandler, here's my friend Ross right here, and we were wondering you know if you're up for it. We only need six more people for a human pyramid...Swoop! Swoop!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hum...So...hum...Oh hey I noticed you were reading the paper...another flood in Europe? Here's a question: "Would you... would you rather drown or be burnt alive?"

utterance.speaker: Blonde girl
utterance.content: Sorry...we were just leaving

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We still got it!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Gavin! I brought you some soup.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: I heard you were sick...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Right! Yeah! Hold on, I'll be just clean up in here a little bit! Hello Gavin

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: I missed you at work today. How are you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I a not gonna lie to you, I'm pretty sick

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Oh! Good! Because I was having a totally paranoid moment when I thought you called in sick to avoid me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no no no

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: So I had fun last night

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So did I

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Exactly how contagious is this thing you have? I mean is it a cold for standing on the balcony or did a monkey bite you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It's just a cold

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Do you have fever? Let me see. Hum...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? What's the matter?

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: What's Ross doing to you on that picture?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh he's dusting me with a fossil brush. He thought it would be funny.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Right. Right. Ross. So what's the deal with you guys? I don't want to get in the middle of anything

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh you're not. You're not gonna get in the middle of anything, don't worry about Ross really, really. Oh! Hide! That's Ross! Hide! Hide!

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Yeah! But you said not to worry about...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I lied! And I'm not sick! Just stay behind the curtain!

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Molly! You're not Ross.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: No I'm here to take Emma to your mother's, remember?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right, right, yes!

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Don't panic!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: There is a man behind your curtain. I have a mace in my purse.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! That's OK! That's OK! That's OK! No no no no! This is my business associate Gavin. He's just being silly. Gavin come out from behind that curtain!

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Hi! Gavin! Please to meet you. It was my idea to stand there.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Hello! I just go and get Emma.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: So hum...Why did I have to hide?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I thought it was Ross.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: So what if it was? I thought there was nothing going on between you two...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: There isn't. There is totally isn't.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: You hear a key in the hole and you jump like a young bronco coming out of a chute for the first time. I used to be a rodeo clown.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right. Look. Gavin...I...I guess I felt guilty that you were here, which I shouldn't. You know Ross and I are not in any relationship but...he is the father of my child, and you know we do live together and plus there is just so much history...you know it's just...I don't know, I'm sorry, I'm just all over the place.

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: It's OK. I know it's probably not my place but can I give you a piece of advice?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: I think you should talk to Ross about all this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: People keep saying that. Oh I'm sorry Gavin

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: Don't be. It's just bad timing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So seriously...rodeo clown?

utterance.speaker: Gavin
utterance.content: One of the best, ma'am, one of the best...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: "No time for losers, 'cause we are the champions of the world...!" Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Oh she's my girlfriend. That's not just how we do it here. I got to get a break and when we come back we've got Kenneth singing "I touch myself"...I'm not here to judge!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi hi...Oh you have got to sing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No I told you I can't.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But you would have so much fun and you have a really nice voice.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What have you heard me sing?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All the time when you're cooking.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah you're always singing "Yummy yummy yummy, I've got love in my tummy"

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah I do rock that one.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: OK so isn't there a little part of you that wants to get up there?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Just a little but...it's just so scary! I don't even know what I would sing...

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Well I've got a book around...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: "Delta Dawn"

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi! I could help not notice, but that's an unusual necklace

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: You already hit on me an hour ago

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Right, so that's a firm "no". I cannot believe this, I just keep striking out.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't get it neither, I mean you're obviously desperate, you're asking women how they want to be killed

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This is great. Rachel's gonna keep kissing guys until she finds the one she wants and I'm gonna die alone.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: By drowning or...?!

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Why would he break up with me?

utterance.speaker: Her friend
utterance.content: I don't know sweetie.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: All I ever wanted was just love him and have him love me back. I mean, am I so unlovable?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: All right, that was Kenneth with his much too literal rendition of "I touch myself". Coming up next we've got Monica singing "Delta Dawn".

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait wait! I can't sing in front of all these people.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Just pretend they're not even here! It's OK Monica, when that spotlight hits you it so bright you won't see anyone anyway.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi! I'm Monica and I'm gonna be singing "Delta Dawn" "Delta Dawn, what's that flower you have on? Could it be a faded rose from days gone by? ..."

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Can you totally see through her shirt ?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Like an X-Ray. Bad day not to wear a bra.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: "To take you to his mansion in the sky-y?"

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, I need your help.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow, it seems serious. What seems to be the problem, Ashley Judd?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, I'll get new headshot taken, all right, so I want to get my eyebrows shaped

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I am sorry, moment to make fun of that, please!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I may be a sissy but I can still pound you into the ground. All right, it hurts so bad, I could only let her do one eyebrow and now... they don't match!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's like a baby caterpillar chasing its mama!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, look, you got to help me out, ok? Look, I have the magic marker, I want you to fill in the skinny one so I don't look stupid for my pictures.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ok. First of all, this is green!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What the hell am I supposed to do!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, I will help you out but you have to promise me you will not tell anyone what I am about to tell you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What, what.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ok, you know how most kids get their allowance from mowing the lawn or taking out the garbage, well I earned mine by plucking the eyebrows of my father and his "business" partners.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I guess you don't need my help Victor Victoria!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ok all right, no, no, no, no, I do, I do, I do, I need your help, but Chandler I don't know if I can take anymore plucking. It hurts so bad!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, not with my combination of ice cubes, aloe Vera and my gentle self-loathing touch.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: "Take me to the mansion in the sky-y". I am sorry, the song is over. Did you see me out there?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Every little bit of you!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can't believe I did this. I can't believe I'm singing for the people, and they liked me! Hey, did you hear that one shouting "look at those tips"! I mean, did I really help you get a lot of tips?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Mon', not that you didn't sound good, but...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Good? Didn't you hear them...I was great! Thank you so much for making me do this. That's is the best gift ever.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Also a good gift? Underwear.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Thank you so much for letting me do this. Public bathrooms freak me out, I can't even pee, let alone do anything else.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But, what's great is that you don't mind talking about it.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: It's so amazing I met you the same day that Eric broke up with me, because it's like you lose a boyfriend, you get a boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh-ah!

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: No don't worry, this is not some rebound thing. I am totally over Eric.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, hey! Hi, there you are, I've been looking for you everywhere!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, hello, well, now, here I am.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Listen, my mum is not bringing the baby back until nine o' clock. So I was hoping you and I could have a chance to kind of talk?somebody here?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, yeah that's Michelle.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, just this woman I've been seeing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You've being seeing someone?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, didn't I mention that? Yeah, I mean, we haven't being going out for too long, but rather there is this amazing connection between us. I-I mean, in fact just before you came in she called me her boyfriend. I thought it was a little too soon, but it was also, you know, it was kinda nice.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: What are you taking amoxicillin for?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How great is this? You are already comfortable enough to look through my stuff. Oh, I am sorry Michelle, that's my roommate, Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi, and I am also Emma's mother.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Ah, who is Emma?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I told you about my daughter.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: This is your daughter? I can be your new mummy!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And done!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh my God! I didn't feel a thing ! Hey, are you still looking for a job because you can tweeze circles around that sadistic bitch at the saloon

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thanks. You wanna see what it looks like?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. Hey, they totally match! They look great! They look great! How you doing!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, I think it looks pretty good. I was a little worried I was uncovering a birthmark right about there, but it turned out to be a little piece of chocolate.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thank you so much.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No problem.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Listen that's a pretty girly hour we just spent, we should add some manly make up for it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Comb my eyelashes.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ok, for my next song I think I'll sing something a little more upbeat. All right? Oh, how about the Pointer Sisters' I am so excited. And make it bouncy!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh you'll probably take care of that on your hands.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I am sorry I am late. You'll understand when you'll see Joey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey, you're just in time, I'm about to sing another song!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really? In front of all this people?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And they love me!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes, she gives the people what they want.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, watch!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: "Tonight's the night we're gonna make it happen, tonight we'll put all other things aside. Give in this time and show me some affection..."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are those my wife's nipples?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh? Isn't that funny? I didn't see that before, I wouldn't have let her go up again.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I gotta stop this.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, who cares, they still love me! "I am so excited..."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You, touching yourself, out!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow. She does that a lot!

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Ross, you didn't tell me you were a doctor!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What, what, wait a minute! You haven't even told her you were a doctor, yet? How long have you known her, like an hour?

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Actually about an hour and a half.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I told you it wasn't long, but there is an amazing connection between us.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: You feel that too? Oh, I thought that was just me!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Are you kidding?

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Hey, do you want to go away this weekend?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We'll see.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ok, Ross, what's going on here, are we just bringing strange women back to the apartment now?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't know, are we just kissing guys on balconies?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: How do you know about that?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Through the magic of sight! I was here, putting our child to sleep...

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Emma.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: When I happened to look through the window and I see you kissing a guy you know, for what? A week?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, that's what this is all about? Did you bring her up here to get back at me?

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: No, actually, see I had to pee, 'cause I can't use public bathrooms because the doodie parasites.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ok, Michelle, it's time to go.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: Well, call me!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: Michelle
utterance.content: No, wait, you don't have my phone number!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know, if it's meant to be, I'll guess it. Bye, bye.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Score.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I am sorry, did you not like her, because I was hoping that we could come to one of your kissing parties on the balcony.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God, I can't believe you're making such a big deal about this. It was one kiss, one guy, one time!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, really!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, really!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What about the guy from the bar?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? Who?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The guy you gave your number to.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Whoa, how do you know about that?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Because he called here looking for you. So don't tell me this...this kissing this guy from work is a one time thing, ok? You've been out there in bars and on balconies for over a month now. And you didn't even have the courtesy to tell me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why didn't I get that message?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: From the guy in the bar, why didn't I get that message?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Because I folded it up and put in my pants pocket. Do you...do you not look there?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I never gave it to you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God. You know what? Who you think you are? Who are you to decide what messages I should or should not get?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Who am I?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I am the guy who's taking care of our baby while you're out at bars meeting guys!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God, I cannot believe this. You know I actually came in here hoping to have a mature conversation with you About us! But I can't do that with someone who hides my messages and brings crazy women back to my apartment!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: None of the sane ones wanted to come back with me! That's not the point. Ok? The point is you...you are the one Who moved on and didn't tell anyone!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, Ross, this is just so messed up! What's wrong with us? You know when people hear about our situation they Always ask, 搘hat, you live together but you're not a couple? And you have a baby, isn't that weird??And I say 揘o. You know what, it's not, because it works for us!?But you know this doesn't work. In fact this is the opposite of working!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, clearly.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And you know, we said that we would, we would live together as long as this makes sense. An maybe this, you know, Just doesn't make sense anymore.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe not. So what you wanna do?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi. Can Emma and I live here for a while?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ha, oh, of course.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Your eyebrows look weird.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: singing "Jeremiah was a bullfrog. Was a good friend of mine, never understood a single word he said, but I helped him drink his wine." So you just touch yourself for anything?
